title: Teacher Burnout Survey (MVP)
description: 28-item survey to assess teacher burnout across 6 key domains. All responses are anonymous.

questions.text: I feel overwhelmed by my teaching workload
I feel emotionally drained from my work
I treat students impersonally
I feel I'm positively influencing students' lives through my work
I have enough time for personal activities outside of work
I receive adequate support from my administration
I have too much paperwork and administrative tasks
Working with students all day is stressful
I don't really care what happens to some students
I deal effectively with student problems
My work schedule allows for adequate rest and recovery
I have access to necessary teaching resources and materials
I feel pressured to meet unrealistic expectations
I feel used up at the end of the workday
I feel students blame me for some of their problems
I feel energized after working closely with students
Work demands interfere with my family life
My colleagues provide helpful professional support
I have more work than I can reasonably handle
I feel burned out from my work
I worry that this job is hardening me emotionally
I can easily create a relaxed atmosphere with my students
I am able to maintain a healthy work-life balance
I receive recognition for my teaching efforts
Class sizes are manageable for effective teaching
I feel frustrated by my job
I feel like I'm at the end of my rope
I accomplish many worthwhile things in this job
